## Description {#details}

Streaming object file generation interface.

This class provides an implementation of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcstreamer">MCStreamer</a> interface which is suitable for use with the assembler backend. Specific object file formats are expected to subclass this interface to implement directives specific to that file format or custom semantics expected by the object writer implementation.

Definition at line 40 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcobjectstreamer-h">MCObjectStreamer.h</a>.

### emitAbsoluteSymbolDiff {#afe30d1dfbe988401ae6ded700dd877bc}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MCObjectStreamer::emitAbsoluteSymbolDiff (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcsymbol">MCSymbol</a> &#42; Hi, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcsymbol">MCSymbol</a> &#42; Lo, unsigned Size)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Emit the absolute difference between two symbols if possible.

Emit the absolute difference between <code>Hi</code> and <code>Lo</code>, as long as we can compute it. Currently, that requires that both symbols are in the same data fragment and that the target has not specified that diff expressions require relocations to be emitted. Otherwise, do nothing and return <code>false</code>.


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
Offset of <code>Hi</code> is greater than the offset <code>Lo</code>.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcobjectstreamer-h/#l00203">203</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcobjectstreamer-h">MCObjectStreamer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/mcobjectstreamer-cpp/#l00104">104</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/mcobjectstreamer-cpp">MCObjectStreamer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### emitAssignment {#a2cff84e102389b6f127a6051d9ff062a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MCObjectStreamer::emitAssignment (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcsymbol">MCSymbol</a> &#42; Symbol, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcexpr">MCExpr</a> &#42; Value)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Emit an assignment of <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a></code> to <code>Symbol</code>.

This corresponds to an assembler statement such as: symbol = value

The assignment generates no code, but has the side effect of binding the value in the current context. For the assembly streamer, this prints the binding into the .s file.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Symbol">- The symbol being assigned to.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="<a href=&quot;/docs/api/classes/llvm/value&quot;>Value</a>">- The value for the symbol.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

### emitValueToAlignment {#a21d70037ecf679b5f8d13af07f8f136a}

  prototype={<>void MCObjectStreamer::emitValueToAlignment (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment, int64&#95;t Value=0, unsigned ValueSize=1, unsigned MaxBytesToEmit=0)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Emit some number of copies of <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a></code> until the byte alignment <code>ByteAlignment</code> is reached.

If the number of bytes need to emit for the alignment is not a multiple of <code>ValueSize</code>, then the contents of the emitted fill bytes is undefined.

This used to implement the .align assembler directive.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Alignment">- The alignment to reach.</ParametersListItem>

<ParametersListItem name="MaxBytesToEmit">- The maximum numbers of bytes to emit, or 0. If the alignment cannot be reached in this many bytes, no bytes are emitted.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>
